goal.core.kr

Interface Database


  • public interface Database
    Database is an interface to a KR dependent implementation. Each database can be viewed as a set of sentences, i.e. closed formula. An API implementation of the Database interface needs to comply with this set-theoretic view of a database and come with a set of associated set-theoretic methods such as defined in the UpdateEngine interface.

    For creating see the KRlanguage#makeDatabase(goal.core.mentalstate.BASETYPE, Theory, String) factory method.

    Each agent is assigned with a SET of databases. The first database that has to be made for an agent is the BASETYPE.KNOWLEDGEBASE database. After that, a single BASETYPE.BELIEFBASE, BASETYPE.MAILBOX, BASETYPE.PERCEPTBASE can be made, and multiple BASETYPE.GOALBASEs are allowed.

    NOTE: that because the order of insertion may be important ArrayLists should be used to implement this interface instead of Sets.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks, W.Pasman 30jan2012 TRAC #1978 extended KR implementation to handle the specific relations that GOAL expects between the various databases of an agent (import of KNOWLEDGE into the other bases; import of mails and percepts in beliefbase).

    removed initialize()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the database. TODO: how exactly is this name used? Each database should be provided with a label for internal reference by the GOAL interpreter.
        Returns:
        the name of this database.

      • getType

        BASETYPE getType()
        Returns the type of the database. Types represent different purposes that a database may be used for, i.e. representing percepts, mail messages, knowledge, beliefs, goals, and other agent's beliefs and goals.
        Returns:
        the BASETYPE of this database.

      • query

        java.util.Set<Substitution> query(Query query)
        Defines the inference mechanism associated with a KRlanguage. The GOAL programming language requires that at least this method is specified in order to be able to effectively operate with the KRlanguage.
        Parameters:
        query - The query.
        Returns:
        set of substitutions. This set is empty if there are no solutions. If there is a one solution without substitutions, returns set with one empty substitution

      • query

        java.util.Set<Substitution> query(CompiledQuery query)
        As query(goal.core.kr.language.Query) except that it takes a precompiled query.
        Parameters:
        query - is the query to be done.
        debugger - is the debugger controlling the call
        Returns:
        set of all possible substitutions that validate the query, or an empty set if the query can not be validated.
        Throws:
        KRQueryFailedException

      • getReceiversOfMessage

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getReceiversOfMessage(Message message)
        Performs a query on the database returning all receivers of the given message according to the message base.
        Parameters:
        message - The message.
        Returns:
        DOC

      • insert

        void insert(DatabaseFormula formula)
        Inserts a formula into the database.

        As a result, the database will entail the added formula. There are no guarantees regarding consistency. I.e., the database may become logically inconsistent.

        Parameters:
        formula - The sentence to be added.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the call.

      • insert

        void insert(Update update)
        Inserts an update to a database. As a result, the database will entail the added formula, but also may become logically inconsistent.
        Parameters:
        update - represents the update to be made.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the update.

      • insert

        DatabaseFormula insert(eis.iilang.Percept percept)
        Inserts a percept into the database.
        Parameters:
        percept - The EIS percept to be inserted.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the call.
        Returns:
        The formula that was added to the percept base.

      • insert

        java.util.Set<DatabaseFormula> insert(Message message,
                                    boolean received)
        Inserts a sent or received fact for the given message into the database.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that has been sent or received.
        received - true if the message has been received; false if it has been sent.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the call.
        Returns:
        The set of database formulas that have been inserted into the database.

      • delete

        void delete(DatabaseFormula formula)
        Removes a formula from a database. After applying the method the sentence that is removed should no longer follow from the database.
        Parameters:
        formula - The formula to be removed.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the update.

      • delete

        void delete(Update update)
        Removes a sentence from a database. After applying the method the sentence that is removed should no longer follow from the database.
        Parameters:
        update - The update which determines what has to be deleted.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the update.

      • delete

        DatabaseFormula delete(eis.iilang.Percept percept)
        Removes a percept from the database.
        Parameters:
        percept - The EIS percept to be deleted.
        debugger - The debugger monitoring the call.
        Returns:
        The formula that was deleted from the percept base.

      • updateAgentFact

        java.util.Set<DatabaseFormula> updateAgentFact(boolean insert,
                                             AgentId id,
                                             boolean me)
                                               throws KRInitFailedException
        Updates the 'agent(name)' fact for agent with id.
        Parameters:
        insert - true if the fact needs to be inserted; false if the fact needs to be removed;
        id - Id of the agent whose related agent fact needs to be updated.
        me - true if the related 'me(name)' fact also needs to be updated.
        database - The database that needs to be updated.
        Returns:
        The facts that were inserted or removed.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException

      • getAllSentences

        DatabaseFormula[] getAllSentences()
                                  throws KRInitFailedException
        Returns all formulas that are stored in the database.
        Returns:
        The method returns a list of all sentences that are elements in the set-theoretical sense of the database.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException

      • cleanUp

        void cleanUp()
             throws KRInitFailedException
        Clean up database before deleting object. Call this method whenever database object is deleted.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException
